business_context.product: Plataforma de streaming profesional de peleas de gallos con apuestas P2P.
business_context.mission: Primera plataforma profesional de streaming + apuestas para galleras.
business_context.timeline: Sprint MVP de 15 días (7-21 de septiembre de 2025)
revenue_model: Acceso a streaming basado en suscripción
Tarifas de transacción en apuestas P2P (Post-MVP)

priorities: Resolución del rendimiento de la base de datos
Activación de la generación de ingresos

admins.capabilities: Control total del sistema, todos los permisos
admins.needs: Monitoreo en tiempo real, gestión de usuarios, análisis

operators.capabilities: Herramientas de administración limitadas, gestión de eventos
operators.needs: Gestión de eventos simplificada, controles de streaming

venues_galleras.capabilities: Creación de eventos, gestión de perfiles, apuestas
venues_galleras.needs: Configuración sencilla de streaming, seguimiento de ingresos

users.capabilities: Ver transmisiones, realizar apuestas, gestionar billetera
users.needs: Transmisiones de calidad, apuestas fáciles, sistema justo

pain_points_prioritized.pain_point: Rendimiento de la base de datos (consultas de 1-3+ segundos)
pain_points_prioritized.impact: Degradación de la experiencia del usuario, bloqueador para el lanzamiento.

pain_points_prioritized.pain_point: Complejidad de integración de sistemas en tiempo real (SSE + WebSocket)
pain_points_prioritized.impact: Riesgo de errores, fugas de memoria y mantenimiento costoso.

requirements: Ingesta de video vía RTMP desde OBS Studio.
Entrega de video a espectadores vía HLS.
Control de acceso basado en estado de suscripción del usuario.
Modelo de apuestas P2P (usuario contra usuario).
Ventanas de apuestas temporales estrictas (solo se puede apostar en estado 'betting').
Sistema de propuestas PAGO/DOY con timeout de 3 minutos vía WebSocket.
Flujo de solicitud de suscripción iniciado por el usuario con aprobación de admin.
Expiración automática de suscripciones y revocación de acceso.

user_workflows.event_creation: Los Admins/Operadores pueden crear eventos y asignarlos a un 'venue' específico.
user_workflows.betting: Los usuarios pueden ver peleas, esperar la ventana de apuestas, y crear/aceptar apuestas P2P.
user_workflows.operator: Los operadores solo pueden gestionar los eventos que les son asignados y no pueden modificar otros admins/operadores.

data_model_clarifications.events_and_venues: Los eventos ocurren EN venues. `events.venue_id` apunta a un `user` con `role='venue'`.
data_model_clarifications.articles_and_authors: Los artículos son escritos POR usuarios. `articles.author_id` apunta al creador. El campo `articles.venue_id` está obsoleto.

platform_quality: 99.5% de tiempo de actividad durante los eventos
<500ms en consultas de base de datos

cost_drivers: CDN bandwidth: ~12 TB/hour for 500 viewers × 3 Mbps = 70-80% of costs
Compute: API backend with SSE connection management = 10-15%

tier_0_galloBets_realworld_$1533_2063_mo.description: GalloBets actual use case: 2×/week, 6h per session, 500 concurrent users, WITH pause optimization
tier_0_galloBets_realworld_$1533_2063_mo.bandwidth_calculation: 500 viewers × 3 Mbps = 1.5 Gbps → 675 GB/hour → 8.1 TB/week (without pause) → 5.4 TB/week (WITH pause between fights)
tier_0_galloBets_realworld_$1533_2063_mo.critical_correction: ⚠️ UNSUITABLE: Previous recommendation of Ant Media Community Edition ($24/mo) has known memory leaks (#5399, #5747, #5029, #6258), no failover (30-45 min recovery if crash), and cannot handle 500 concurrent reliably. BunnyCDN Stream Storage does NOT support RTMP live streaming (VOD only).

advantages: No infrastructure management - fully managed by Wowza
No memory leak issues or maintenance
recommended_solution_wowza_cloud.suitable_for: GalloBets production (reliable, professional, cost appropriate for 500 concurrent)

alternative_solution_ant_media_enterpris.platform: Ant Media Server Enterprise (if choosing open-source approach)
alternative_solution_ant_media_enterpris.requirements: Requires proper clustering setup with MongoDB and load balancer
alternative_solution_ant_media_enterpris.compute: Vultr/Linode 8-core 16GB RAM = $48-96/month (clustered setup requires more resources)
disadvantages: Risk of misconfiguration causing performance issues
Enterprise Edition has cost; Community Edition unsuitable
Requires dedicated ops knowledge or hiring
alternative_solution_ant_media_enterpris.suitable_for: NOT recommended unless team has Ant Media expertise and wants operational control

ant_media_community_edition.reason: Memory leaks, no failover, no support - unsuitable for production

bunnycdn_stream_storage.reason: Does NOT support RTMP live streaming - only VOD uploads
bunnycdn_stream_storage.actual_capability: For VOD/archival only, not for live events

tier_0_galloBets_realworld_$1533_2063_mo.cost_optimization: Pause/resume streaming between fights reduces bandwidth by 35-40% (5.4TB vs 8.1TB/week), but applies ONLY to CDN costs (Bunny if using Ant Enterprise); Wowza pricing is fixed per concurrent user

tier_1_basic_24h_$2100_3200_month.streaming_ingest: Ant Media Server open-source on VPS = $24/month
tier_1_basic_24h_$2100_3200_month.suitable_for: 24h streaming, high-volume events (not GalloBets use case)

tier_0_480p_galloBets_$205_month_RECOMME.description: GalloBets final recommended stack: 480p + pause optimization + Neon.tech
tier_0_480p_galloBets_$205_month_RECOMME.rationale: 480p reduces bandwidth 50% vs 720p. Pause between fights saves 35-40% more. Total = most cost-effective for 2×/week, 6h sessions with 500 concurrent users
tier_0_480p_galloBets_$205_month_RECOMME.database: Neon.tech PostgreSQL managed = $50/month (includes auto-scaling, built-in backups, connection pooling)
tier_0_480p_galloBets_$205_month_RECOMME.streaming_origin: Ant Media Server on VPS = $24/month (open-source, handles pause/resume natively)
tier_0_480p_galloBets_$205_month_RECOMME.cdn_distribution: Bunny CDN HLS @ 480p = $108/month (0.01/GB × 10.8 TB/month with pause)
tier_0_480p_galloBets_$205_month_RECOMME.quality_notes: 480p = 854×480 pixels sufficient for cockfighting detail (camera focused on birds). Fallback to 720p available for users >5 Mbps.

tier_3_optimized_$500_800_month.suitable_for: Regional galleras with scheduled events (peak hours only, no 24h streaming)

cost_optimization_strategies: ✅ 480p streaming: Reduce bandwidth 50% vs 720p = $108/month CDN cost (vs $216 with 720p)
✅ PAUSE/RESUME between fights: Reduce effective streaming 6h→4h = 35-40% bandwidth savings
✅ Bunny CDN is 5× cheaper than CloudFront ($0.01/GB vs $0.085/month)
✅ Scheduled streaming (2×/week) vs 24/7 = 94% cost savings ($205/mo vs $2,100+)
✅ Off-peak cutoff: Stream only event hours, pause rest of day
✅ Adaptive bitrate streaming (ABR): Reduce per-user bandwidth 20-30% (HLS.js handles client-side)
✅ Origin-shield: Reduces origin bandwidth 30-50% (Bunny CDN native feature)
✅ Neon.tech managed PostgreSQL: Connection pooling + auto-scaling + 99.99% uptime SLA
✅ Connection pooling with PgBouncer: Reduce database overhead (Neon includes native pooling)

real_world_cost_projection_galloBets.scenario: 2 sessions/week, 6 hours each, 500 concurrent users, WITH pause optimization + 480p

720p_at_3mbps.per_session_with_pause: 2.7 TB per session (4h effective with 2h pause between fights)

480p_at_1_5mbps.per_hour: 500 viewers × 1.5 Mbps = 750 Mbps = 337.5 GB/hour (50% reduction vs 720p)
480p_at_1_5mbps.per_session_with_pause: 1.35 TB per session (4h effective with 2h pause between fights)

real_world_cost_projection_galloBets.comparison_24h_streaming: 24h would cost $2,100-5,300/month = $25K-64K/year (9-25× more expensive than 480p scheduled)

critical_dependencies: Backend Performance Analysis (BACKEND_PERFORMANCE_ANALYSIS_PLAN) MUST complete before scaling to 500 users
Memory leaks in SSE/WebSocket would cause exponential cost growth in production
Database connection pooling MUST be optimized (currently max: 20, required: 100 for 500 users)
